message.commandkeys.sendBlocked: Ratelimit exceeded by key %s. Ratelimit is set to %s activations in %s ticks.
option.commandkeys.key.alt.tooltip: This key, if pressed when the macro is activated, will reverse the cycle order.
option.commandkeys.key.conflict.assert.t: If the key is already used by Minecraft, this keybind will be activated first, then the other keybind.
option.commandkeys.key.conflict.avoid.to: This keybind will not function in-game, but can be activated by pressing the key while on the profile options screen (if nothing is selected).
option.commandkeys.key.conflict.submit.t: If the key is already used by Minecraft, this keybind will be cancelled.
option.commandkeys.key.conflict.veto.too:
If the key is already used by Minecraft, the other keybind will be cancelled.
Note: Some keys (such as movement keys) cannot be cancelled.
option.commandkeys.key.cycle.index.toolt: The index of the next message to be sent.
Time in ticks to wait after the key-press, before sending.
Time in ticks to wait after the previous message, before sending.
option.commandkeys.key.delay.tooltip:
Delay in ticks before each message after the first.
Set to 0 to use per-message delays.
option.commandkeys.key.delay.tooltip.rep:
Delay in ticks between repeats.
If you set this to 40, each message will be sent every 40 ticks, offset from each other as specified by individual delays.
option.commandkeys.key.mode.cycle.toolti:
Messages will be cycled through, one per key-press.
In this mode, you can send multiple messages in a single key-press by separating them with two commas e.g. /lobby,,/nick
option.commandkeys.key.mode.random.toolt: When the key is pressed, one of the messages will be randomly chosen and sent.
option.commandkeys.key.mode.repeat.toolt: Messages will be sent initially, then again at intervals of the specified delay.
option.commandkeys.key.mode.type.tooltip: The first message will be typed in chat, but not sent.
option.commandkeys.key.repeat.stop.toolt: This macro is actively repeating. Click here to stop it.
option.commandkeys.macro.hud.tooltip: Briefly show the sent message/command as a pop-up above the hotbar.
option.commandkeys.main.default.tooltip: These options will be used by new Macro instances.
option.commandkeys.main.default_multipla: This is the default profile for multiplayer
option.commandkeys.main.default_singlepl: This is the default profile for singleplayer
option.commandkeys.main.name: Name
option.commandkeys.main.profiles.tooltip:
Profiles are automatically activated when you join a world/server linked to a profile.
The default profiles are used when there is no linked profile.
Number of activations allowed in the specified timespan.
option.commandkeys.main.ratelimit.hard.t: If enabled, blocked activations will contribute to ratelimiting.
option.commandkeys.main.ratelimit.toolti: Limits activation rate to M activations in N ticks. Useful for preventing spam on servers.
option.commandkeys.profile.history.toolt:
Add sent messages/commands to history.
Set to 'Defer' to configure per-macro.
option.commandkeys.profile.hud.tooltip:
Briefly show the sent message/command as a pop-up above the hotbar.
Set to 'Defer' to configure per-macro.
option.commandkeys.profile.keys.tooltip:
Activate a macro by pressing its keybind in-game.
Macros with a single bound key can also be activated on this screen if nothing is selected.
